GEO_notes: It is located in Bukhara, a more specific location could not be found so I coded up to the ADM1
name: Bukhoro

title: $2.1 million Chinese Government loan for modernization of Damkhoja interregional water pipe (1st phase)
description: In 2008, the IMF reported that the Chinese Government provided a loan of $2.1 million to Uzbekistan for the modernization of the Damkhoja interregional water pipe (1st phase). Total investment for the project is $2.3 million. The current status of the project and loan details are unknown. STAFF_NOTE: Year marked as uncertain because loan may have been committed before 2008.
sources: https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/CR/Issues/2016/12/31/Republic-of-Uzbekistan-Poverty-Reduction-Strategy-Paper-21636, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
GEO_notes: On the bottom of page 20 of the world bank source, it says that the Domkhoja water pipe supplies water to the city of Bukhara from water chanels in the Samarkand region. So I coded up to the two regions, the Bukhara (Buxoro) region and the Samarkand region.
name: Bukhoro

title: $1 million Chinese Government loan for improvement of waste water treatment system of Bukhara (linked to #54506)
description: China provided a $1 million government loan to Uzbekistan for improvement of the waste water treatment system of Bukhara, as recorded by the 2008 IMF country report. Total investments for the project were $1.1 million. Current project status and loan details are unknown. STAFF_NOTE: This project is recorded in the 2008 IMF report, but loan may have been committed before 2008, so year is marked uncertain. Project could not be confirmed by any other sources. This project is linked to a similar commitment in Samarkand (#54506)
sources: https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/CR/Issues/2016/12/31/Republic-of-Uzbekistan-Poverty-Reduction-Strategy-Paper-21636, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
GEO_notes: The water system is located in Bukhara, unclear if referring to the district or region by that name so coded up just to be safe.
name: Bukhoro

title: China Eximbank provides $70.11 million loan for purchase of Chinese electric locomotives (Linked to #40131)
description:
In November 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Uzbekistan signed an MOU in which China pledged to offer concessional loans to Uzbekistan for the acquisition of electric locomotives from China.

In May 2009, Uzbekiston Temir Yollari State Joint-Stock Railway Company (Uzbekistan Railways SJSRC) signed a contract with CSR Zhuzhou Electric Locomotive Company for the supply of 15 electric locomotives. The total cost of the project was $75.53 million. China Eximbank loaned $70,110,000 in Preferential Buyer's Credits to the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan to support this contract. The loan carried the following terms:  20 year maturity,  5 year grace period, 2% interest rate, 0.3% commitment fee, and 0.3% management fee. Uzbekistan Railways SJSRC covered the remaining cost of the project.

The projected speed of the electric locomotives was 160 km per hour, which would allow to double passenger turnover at the electrified railway roads of Uzbekistan. The new locomotives were to be used on the Samarkand-Khojidavlet railway line and Navoi-Samarkand line.  All 15 electic locomotives were delivered to Uzbekistan Railways SJSRC by the end of 2010.  

Staff Note: The Russian name of this project is «Узбекистон темир йуллари». Закупки пассажирских электровозов».
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZBDAY0020100812e68c0008e&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TRENDE0020100608e668004ed&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/dfpd/2010-04/22/content_9762036.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/200805/20080505524955.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://finance.ifeng.com/roll/20100613/2312038.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/O'Z-Y%E5%9E%8B%E7%94%B5%E5%8A%9B%E6%9C%BA%E8%BD%A6, Other; https://lex.uz/docs/1450728?query=%D1%88%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%85%D0%B0%D0%B9, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.lex.uz/ru/docs/1450728, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
factiva_sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZBDAY0020100812e68c0008e&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TRENDE0020100608e668004ed&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: Khojidavlet is located in Bukhara. I was able to find a map of the train system in the source listed. Because the line that the trains are on is from Samarkand, Navoi, and Burkhara, I coded up to these regions because it goes through so many districts.
name: Bukhoro

title: Chinese Government grants $20 million for the acquisition of 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats (linked to #40111)
description:
On March 11, 2014, the Chinese Government and the Government of Uzbekistan signed an agreement to grant $20 million USD to Uzbekistan for the acquisition of 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats. The purpose of this project was to improve the irrigation system and to increase water availability and productivity of land in Uzbekistan. In total, 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats were delivered to Uzbekistan under this project. Project implementation facilities are located in Karakalpakstan, Khorezm, Bukhara and Kashkadarya regions. This project was completed on October 10, 2018.

STAFF NOTE: The Russian project name is  "Поставка земснарядов и комплектующих лодок в Узбекистан за счет грантовых средств правительства КНР”. This project is linked to Phase I of the Amu Darya (Amudarya) river clean up (captured in #40111).
sources: https://podrobno.uz/mobile_app/news/uzbekistan-i-kitay-klyuchi-ot-budushchego/10-znamenatelnykh-sobytiy-v/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://en.cidca.gov.cn/2018-10/12/c_283454.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nuz.uz/ekonomika-i-finansy/24892-priobretenie-dvuh-drimlaynerov-dlya-uzbekiston-havo-yullari-profinansiroval-kitay.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=332422_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_11_03_2014_g_n_pp-2144_o_merah_po_obespecheniyu_effektivnogo_ispolzovaniya_bezvozmezdnoy_pomoshchi_predostavlyaemoy_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki_dlya_postavki_zemsnaryadov_komplektuyushchih_lodok_i_prinadlejnostey_k_nim, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.agro.uz/ru/information/about_agriculture/646/9007/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
name: Bukhoro

title: China Eximbank provides $5.04 million loan for Kenimeh-1 Pumping Station Reconstruction Project
description:
On May 6, 2014, China Eximbank and National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $5.0407 million loan agreement for the Kenimeh-1 Pumping Station Reconstruction Project. The terms of this loan are as follows: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period, and 2.2% interest rate. This project is located in the Navoi region in Uzbekistan. The total project cost was $5.306 million USD, with the Uzbek Government financing the remaining costs.

China National Electric Engineering Co., Ltd is the contractor responsible for project implementation. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is «Реконструкция насосной станции «Кенимех-1» в Навоийской области».
sources: https://extranet.who.int/countryplanningcycles/sites/default/files/planning_cycle_repository/uzbekistan/wis_spbn_2013-2015eng.pdf, Other; https://nbu.uz/upload/iblock/e22/3_GO_NBU.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/acts/2447250, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://online.zakon.kz/Document/?doc_id=30982413, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: This project is located in the Navoi region
name: Navoi

description:
On November 11, 2004, China Eximbank signed a General Loan Agreement for a 300 million USD preferential buyer's credit to Uzbekistan (#39956). Under this agreement, China Eximbank allocated $5.1 million USD in export buyer's credits for the purchase of 60-65 excavators to improve of the reclamation state of irrigated lands in the Bukhara, Navoi and Kashkadarya regions. Uzbekistan Ministry of Agriculture and Water Resources undertook the project. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian name of this project is Улучшение мелиоративного состояния земель Бухарской, Навоийской и Кашкадарьинской областей. Loan details are unknown.
sources: https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=407118_postanovlenie_kabineta_ministrov_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_19_07_2004_g_n_338_o_merah_po_dalneyshemu_razvitiyu_sotrudnichestva_s_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respublikoy , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305021_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_05_2005_g_n_pp-82_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana , Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese Government grants $4.7 million for the provision of medical equipment to 5 regional rehabilitation centers
description: In 2016, the Chinese government agreed to grant $4.7 million USD to the Ministry of Health of Uzbekistan for the provision of modern medical equipment to regional rehabilitation centers for the disabled. The grant was distributed to equip 5 rehabilitation centers (Namangen, Navoi, Jizzakh, Samarkand and Tashkent regions) for the disabled with laboratories and medical equipment, including modern diagnostic and physiotherapy equipment, X-ray diagnostic equipment, exercise therapy equipment, and laboratory equipment. According to the Review.Uz article, the MRI scanners were delivered to Uzbekistan in 2018.
sources: https://review.uz/ru/post/kitayskiy-vektor-uzbekskoy-ekonomiki, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Coded the Navoiy Region. The grant was given to 5 rehab centers, which the decription stated they were in the Namangen, Navoi, Jizzakh, Samarkand and Tashkent regions. No further informaiton was found as to where these rehab center were located in the regions.
name: Navoi

title: Chinese Government grants $20 million for the acquisition of 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats (linked to #40111)
description:
On March 11, 2014, the Chinese Government and the Government of Uzbekistan signed an agreement to grant $20 million USD to Uzbekistan for the acquisition of 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats. The purpose of this project was to improve the irrigation system and to increase water availability and productivity of land in Uzbekistan. In total, 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats were delivered to Uzbekistan under this project. Project implementation facilities are located in Karakalpakstan, Khorezm, Bukhara and Kashkadarya regions. This project was completed on October 10, 2018.

STAFF NOTE: The Russian project name is  "Поставка земснарядов и комплектующих лодок в Узбекистан за счет грантовых средств правительства КНР”. This project is linked to Phase I of the Amu Darya (Amudarya) river clean up (captured in #40111).

title: China grants 5 seismological stations worth 300K USD
description: In 2003, China Seismological Bureau gave 5 seismological stations that worth 300,000 dollars to the Uzbek Academy of Sciences. This aid is based on an agreement signed between these two parties in 2001. China also sent specialists to provide the assistance with setting up and using the equipment. Four of these stations were installed in Tashkent, and one was installed in central Uzbekistan. This donation aims to modernize Uzbekistan's capacity to register and study earthquakes.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020030910dz9a001ba&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://isas.uzsci.net/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=2&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwixsfOY4vfKAhUKxWMKHTyHCgUQFggjMAE&url=http%3A%2F%2Fds.iris.edu%2Fmedia%2Fworkshop%2F2012%2F01%2Fmanaging-waveform-data-and-related-metadata-for-seismic-networks%2Ffiles%2Fnetwork-reports%2FUzbekistan-InstSeismology-ILKHOM-15.ppt&usg=AFQjCNGnqvUbpdOWv2Yg4dxTSU0UESysCg&sig2=Arl7xR1HLjwrDmfsljxfYg, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

name: Samarkand

title: China Eximbank provides $70.11 million loan for purchase of Chinese electric locomotives (Linked to #40131)
description:
In November 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Uzbekistan signed an MOU in which China pledged to offer concessional loans to Uzbekistan for the acquisition of electric locomotives from China.

In May 2009, Uzbekiston Temir Yollari State Joint-Stock Railway Company (Uzbekistan Railways SJSRC) signed a contract with CSR Zhuzhou Electric Locomotive Company for the supply of 15 electric locomotives. The total cost of the project was $75.53 million. China Eximbank loaned $70,110,000 in Preferential Buyer's Credits to the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan to support this contract. The loan carried the following terms:  20 year maturity,  5 year grace period, 2% interest rate, 0.3% commitment fee, and 0.3% management fee. Uzbekistan Railways SJSRC covered the remaining cost of the project.

The projected speed of the electric locomotives was 160 km per hour, which would allow to double passenger turnover at the electrified railway roads of Uzbekistan. The new locomotives were to be used on the Samarkand-Khojidavlet railway line and Navoi-Samarkand line.  All 15 electic locomotives were delivered to Uzbekistan Railways SJSRC by the end of 2010.  

Staff Note: The Russian name of this project is «Узбекистон темир йуллари». Закупки пассажирских электровозов».
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZBDAY0020100812e68c0008e&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TRENDE0020100608e668004ed&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/dfpd/2010-04/22/content_9762036.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/200805/20080505524955.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://finance.ifeng.com/roll/20100613/2312038.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/O'Z-Y%E5%9E%8B%E7%94%B5%E5%8A%9B%E6%9C%BA%E8%BD%A6, Other; https://lex.uz/docs/1450728?query=%D1%88%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%85%D0%B0%D0%B9, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.lex.uz/ru/docs/1450728, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
factiva_sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZBDAY0020100812e68c0008e&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TRENDE0020100608e668004ed&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: Khojidavlet is located in Bukhara. I was able to find a map of the train system in the source listed. Because the line that the trains are on is from Samarkand, Navoi, and Burkhara, I coded up to these regions because it goes through so many districts.
name: Samarkand

title: Chinese Government grants $14 million for the supply of medical equipment to Uzbekistan
description:
In 2016, the Chinese government agreed to grant $14 million USD for the supply of 22 MRI units to 4 city hospitals in Tashkent, 5 regional multidisciplinary medical centers (for adults) in Tashkent, Ferghana, Jizzakh, Khorezm and Syrdarya regions, and 13 regional children's multidisciplinary medical centers.

According to the Review.Uz article, the MRI scanners were delivered to Uzbekistan in 2018.

title: Chinese Government provides $500,000 grant for earthquake relief
description:
On July 20, 2011, the Chinese Government pledged to provide the Government of Uzbekistan with a $500,000 grant for emergency relief after an earthquake.

On December 26, 2011, Chinese ambassador Zhang Wei and Uzbekistan’s Deputy Minister of Finance Jorkin Tulsonov signed an intergovernmental transfer certificate for the Uzbek government’s $500,000 foreign exchange humanitarian assistance project in Tashkent.

title: China Eximbank provides $8.48 million loan for improvement of the meliorative network of arable land in central Ferghana
description:
On February 14, 2008, China Eximbank provided a $8.48 million loan to the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan for improvement of the meliorative network of arable land in central Ferghana. The loan had a maturity of 20 years, a grace period of 5 years, and an interest rate of 2%. The total budget for the project was $20.5 million.

China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The current status of the project is unknown. 

Staff Note: the Russian project title is «Улучшение мелиоративной сети пахотных земель Центральной Ферганы»

title: Chinese government loans $15 million for reconstruction and expansion of sewage treatment plants of Namangan
description: In 2008, China provided a $15 million government loan to Uzbekistan for the reconstruction and expansion of the sewage treatment plants of Namangan. Total investments for the project were $15.8 million. Current project status and loan details are unknown. STAFF_NOTE: Project was recorded in Uzbekistan's 2008 IMF report but loan could have been committed earlier, so year is marked uncertain. This project could not be confirmed with any additional sources.

title: China Eximbank provides $6 million loan for rehabilitation of Gulbakhor pumping station in Andijan oblast
description:
On October 2, 2008, China Eximbank and the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $5,759,830 loan agreement for the rehabilitation of Gulbakhor pumping station in Andijan oblast. The loan carried the following terms: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period. 2% interest rate, 0.3% commitment fee, and 0.3% management fee. The National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan use the proceeds of this loan to on-lend to an unidentified entity at a 2.2% interest rate.

China National Electric Equipment Corporation (CNEEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. This project was reportedly completed in 2010.  

Staff Note: The Russian name of this project is  «Реконструкция насосной станции «Гульбахор 1К».

name: Andijon

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 100 million loan for acquisition of 2500 tractors
description:
On November 3, 2001, China Eximbank and Pakhtabank OJSC signed a an RMB 100 million loan agreement for the purchase of 2,500 Chinese-made tractors. The loan carried the following terms: 10 year maturity, 3 year grace period, and 4% interest rate. Pakhtabank OJSC is a commercial agricultural bank that primarily lends to farmers. The Government of Uzbekistan provided a sovereign guarantee for this loan.

The tractors will were to be produced by from Zhongce Tractor and Motor Vehicle Co. Ltd and delivered by Tianjin Machinery Import & Export Corporation to Tashkent Tractor Plant Joint Stock Company. 

Staff Note: The Russian project title is "проекта сборочного производства мини-тракторов". Pakhtabank OJSC may have on-lent the proceeds of the China Eximbank loan to Tashkent Tractor Plant Joint Stock Company (or ГАО “Ташкентский тракторный завод”).

title: Chinese Government provides a $1 million grant for provision computer training equipment to 100 Uzbek schools (Linked to Project ID#54521)
description:
On July 18, 2005, the Chinese government provided a $1 million grant to the Government of Uzbekistan for the provision of computer training equipment to 100 basic educational schools. China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (CMC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. According to the Uzbekistan President's document, the $1 million grant was used for the purchase of 100 sets of educational computer courses provided by a Chinese company. 

In addition to this grant, China Eximbank supported the same project with an RMB 157 million loan (see Project ID#54521). 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian name of the project is "Оснащение общеобразовательных школ Республики Узбекистан учебными компьютерными классами”.
sources: https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305258_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_11_2005_g_n_pp-226_o_merah_po_realizacii_proekta_osnashchenie_obshcheobrazovatelnyh_shkol_respubliki_uzbekistan_uchebnymi_kompyuternymi_klassami_s_ispolzovaniem_lgotnogo_kredita_i_granta_pravitelstva_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://mg.uz/print/publish/doc/text60491_v_uzbekistane_svyshe_75_procentov_shkol_vo_vseh_regionah_strany_budut_obespecheny_kompyuternoy_tehnikoy, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: This project is coded up to country level since there were multiple schools in the country that received training equipment, not just one specific location
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Development Bank lent $107.1 million in 2016 for the acquisition of Boeing aircraft (Linked to Project ID#54522)
description:
In 2016, China Development Bank lent $107.1 million for the acquisition of Boeing aircraft. The proceeds of this loan were used by Uzbekistan Airways (NAC Uzbekistan Havo Yollari) to buy at least one Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner. The Government of Uzbekistan provided a sovereign guarantee for this loan. The purchase resolution codes are 01.03.2018 N PP-3575 and 30.04.2018 N PP-3689 made by the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan. The loan details are unknown.

In 2016, ICBC also provided a loan for the acquisition of four Boeing 787-8 aircraft (captured in #54522).

Staff_Note: The Russian project title is Приобретение нового самолета Боинг-787-8. Some sources suggest that Uzbekistan Airways (NAC Uzbekistan Havo Yollari) used the proceeds of the CDB loan to buy 3 Boeing 787-8 Dreamliners. Uzbekistan Airways (NAC Uzbekistan Havo Yollari) reportedly received one Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner in September 2016, another in November 2016, and a third in 2018.
sources: https://nuz.uz/ekonomika-i-finansy/24892-priobretenie-dvuh-drimlaynerov-dlya-uzbekiston-havo-yullari-profinansiroval-kitay.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=611675_adresnaya_programma_investicionnyh_proektov_realizuemyh_v_2020_godu_s_privlecheniem_inostrannyh_kreditov_pod_gosudarstvennuyu_garantiyu_respubliki_uzbekistan_(prilojenie_n_4_k_postanovleniyu_prezidenta_ruz_ot_09_01_2020_g_n_pp-4563), Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://uzairways.online/news/nak-uzbekiston-khavo-yullari-rasshirit-park-samoletov, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/bjhwsmdorj21jmq/OUR%20PROJECTS%20-%20Fund%20for%20Reconstruction%20and%20Development%20of%20the%20Republic%20of%20Uzbekistan.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://ria.ru/20161105/1480711611.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://china-uz-friendship.com/?p=56, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://tashkenttimes.uz/business/517-uzbekistan-ready-to-create-unprecedented-conditions-for-u-s-companies, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: This project is coded up to country level since there is not one specific location that received the loan, even though the airway company received the loan to purchase the aircraft, overall more areas may benefit from the usage of the plane
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese Government grants 48,000,000 USD for the provision of multimedia equipment to 5th-9th grade classrooms (Linked with projects #71501, #72568, #72567, #72569, #72570, and #72571)
description: On August 22, 2014, China agreed to allocate US$48,000,000 to the Ministry of Public Education of Uzbekistan for the provision of multimedia equipment for 5th-9th grade classrooms. The donation money was utilized in three phases, each of which cost $16,000,000. These sets of equipment were comprised of: 1 computer with printer for teachers, 12 pieces of computer equipment for students, 1 projector, 1 interactive media tool (electronic pen), 1 air conditioner, 1 stabilizer The classroom upgrades seek to improve teacher proficiency in foreign language and informatics instruction in classrooms across the republic. The equipment was provided to 1303 classrooms in total. The acquisition was part of a push by Uzbekistan to attract grant aid for its education system. It was reported that Uzbekistan attracted $225.6 million of grant aid for this purpose, some of which was provided by the People's Republic of China. As such, this project is linked to several other Chinese donations to the education sector during this timeframe: #71501 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 1st-4th #72568 for the purchase of 740 pieces of computer equipment for special needs students #72569 for the purchase of computer hardware and computer equipment. #72570 for the equipping of children's centers 'Barkamol Avlod' with 434 sets of computer equipment #72571 for the purchase of new stage equipment for the Republican Center for Children's Artistic Creativity #72567 for the purchase of new equipment for the Center for the Development of Multimedia General Education Programs (CDMEP) STAFF_NOTE: News sources put this figure at $73,500,000 - this is the number for the aggregate grant for both grades 1-4 and 5-9, which we have split between two separate projects
sources: https://nuz.uz/ekonomika-i-finansy/24892-priobretenie-dvuh-drimlaynerov-dlya-uzbekiston-havo-yullari-profinansiroval-kitay.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://silkroadnews.org/en/news/uzbekistan-will-receive-from-china-73-5-million-for-school-facilities, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://tm.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201408/20140800708334.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g6DTNMS2LBo, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/22hvebgshk1eviz/IQ%20participates%20in%20China%20foreign%20aid%20project%20and%20provides%20IQ%20Interactive%20Whiteboard%20to%201303%20schools%20of%20Uzbekistan.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://china-uz-friendship.com/?p=12347, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: This project is coded up to country level since the schools that received the multimedia equipment donation were not specified and there were multiple locations. note that there are specific project IDs that capture certain donations within this donation of money
name: Uzbekistan

title: China grants $2,670,100 USD for the purchase of special needs computing equipment (Linked to #71501, #72571, #72567, #72569, #72570, and #72564)
description: In 2014, China committed a US$2,670,100 to the Ministry of Public Education for the purchase of computer equipment for special needs students. This equipment specifically included: 740 specialized computers for children with special needs, equipment for audio classrooms, 28 pieces of hearing-speech complexes, and devices and typewriters for writing in Braille The equipment was provided to all 87 specialized boarding schools of the republic.The acquisition was part of a push by Uzbekistan to attract grant aid for its education system. It was reported that Uzbekistan attracted $225.6 million of grant aid for this purpose, some of which was provided by the People's Republic of China. As such, this project is linked to several other Chinese donations to the education sector during this timeframe: #71501 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 1st-4th #72567 for the purchase of new equipment for the Center for the Development of Multimedia General Education Programs (CDMEP) #72569 for the purchase of computer hardware and computer equipment. #72570 for the equipping of children's centers 'Barkamol Avlod' with 434 sets of computer equipment #72571 for the purchase of new stage equipment for the Republican Center for Children's Artistic Creativity #72564 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 5th-9th
sources: https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: This project is coded up to country level since the schools that received the special computer equipment donations were not specified and there were multiple locations. Note that this project ID is also linked to other educational donations from china
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Eximbank provides $73.6 million loan for Gas Network Modernization Project
description: In 2007, China Eximbank agreed to loan $73.6 million USD to Uzbekneftegaz (Uzbekistan's state-owned oil and gas company) for the modernization of its gas transportation system. The reported terms of the China Eximbank loan were as follows: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period, 2% interest rate. The Uzbek Government also provided a sovereign guarantee for the loan. The total cost of the project was $81 million and it was to be financed by China Eximbank with a $73.6 million loan and $7.4 million from Uztransgaz. It was expected that the proceeds from the China Eximbank loan would be used to buy the necessary equipment to install a modern supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system -- i.e. a 2,000 km fiber optic line -- alongside a gas pipeline. The purpose of the SCADA system was to minimize leakages in the gas transportation system. The project was to be launched in 2008 and implemented within 1.5 years. In June 2010, Uztransgaz and Alcatel-Lucent Shanghai Bell Co. signed a $77.5 million agreement to implement the project. However, in May 2012, Uzbekneftegaz said that the project had been suspended due to a technical dispute, but did not disclose any further details. Then, in 2013, Alcatel-Lucent Shanghai Bell Co. and Uzbekneftegaz signaled that they working to resolve their dispute. The final status of the project is unclear, so for the time being it remains status-coded as an official commitment that never reached implementation.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZBDAY0020100611e66b0002u&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://china-uz-friendship.com/?p=1001, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/zjdgj0xh1zrppd9/Lecture%235.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/10842, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/1763, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/23260, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: This project is coded up to country level since there is no specified location of where the gas transportation was updated or where the new fibre optic line and gas pipeline were installed. Also multiple areas of the country may benefit from the modernization of the gas transportation
name: Uzbekistan

title: China extends 60 million USD line of credit to Uzbekistan to support Uzbek enterprises
description: On August 14, 2007, the National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of the Republic of Uzbekistan signed a loan agreement with the State Development Bank of China to attract a credit line in the amount of 60 million USD for a period of 12 years, including a grace period of 2.5 years. The funds of the credit line of the State Development Bank of China are allocated for the implementation of investment projects in the following main areas: The acquisition of mini-technologies and compact equipment for the deep processing of fruits and vegetables Livestock and other agricultural products The creation of modern localizing industries with deep processing of local raw materials; production of building materials, including the development of new types of production Production of finished consumer goods for food and non-food purposes; development of services and services, including tourism To provide loans at the expense of attracted credit lines from the State Development Bank of China to small businesses and private entrepreneurship for up to 7 years in the amount of from 100 thousand to 1 million US dollars.
sources: https://www.neweurope.eu/article/bank-raises-loan-state-development-bank-china/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/lzho8fwdez4sgwo/PP-699-dream%2009_28_2007.%20ON%20MEASURES%20FOR%20THE%20USE%20OF%20A%20LOAN%20OF%20A%20STATE%20CHINA%20DEVELOPMENT%20BANK.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=306035_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_28_09_2007_g_n_pp-699_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_kredita_gosudarstvennogo_banka_razvitiya_kitaya, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/catalog/201008/20100807080906.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: This project is coded up to country level since there is no specific location found where the credit line was used for, also the intended use of the credit line benefitted multiple areas of the country
name: Uzbekistan

title: ICBC and FRDU provide debt financing to Uzbekistan for purchase of four Boeing aircraft (linked to #72173)
description:
In 2016, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) and the Fund for Reconstruction and Development of Uzbekistan (FRDU) committed $552,661,846 in debt financing to Uzbekistan for the purchase of four new Boeing 787-8 aircraft. The amount of financing provided by the ICBC is unknown. The planned dates of project implementation are 2016-2020.

In 2016, China Development Bank lent $107.1 million for the acquisition of a new Boeing 787-8 aircraft as well (captured in #72173).

STAFF NOTE: The Russian name of this project is Приобретение четырех новых самолетов "Боинг-787-8”.
sources: https://invest.gov.uz/en/invest-projects-taxonomy/realizuemye-investitsionnye-proekty/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://web.archive.org/web/20200422155947/https://invest.gov.uz/uz/invest-projects-taxonomy/realizuemye-investitsionnye-proekty/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://uzairways.online/news/nak-uzbekiston-khavo-yullari-rasshirit-park-samoletov, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=602433_adresnaya_programma_investicionnyh_proektov_na_2019_god_realizuemyh_s_privlecheniem_inostrannyh_kreditov_pod_gosudarstvennuyu_garantiyu_respubliki_uzbekistan_(prilojenie_n_10_k_postanovleniyu_prezidenta_ruz_ot_19_12_2018_g_n_pp-4067), Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://uznews.uz/ru/article/9291, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://stv.uz/news/economic/7545-nak-priobretet-esche-tri-novyh-drimlaynera.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: This project is coded up to country level since there is not one specific location or airline that received the loan, and overall multiple areas of the country may benefit from the usage of the plane

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 25 million grant for the provision of container inspection equipment
description: On February 5, 2009, the Chinese Government and the Government of Uzbekistan signed letters of exchange for on a grant of RMB 25 million (3.7 million USD) for the provision of mobile x-ray (customs inspection) equipment to prevent smuggling and boost trade. The RMB 25 million grant was drawn from the proceeds of an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ECTA) that was signed on August 23, 2006.

The details of the loan are unknown.

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 21 million loan for supply of 45 units of diagnostic equipment and their installation in 15 oncology centers (linked to #39957)
description:
On June 15, 2004, China Eximbank signed an agreement to provide a 300 million RMB concessional loan to the Republic of Uzbekistan for various projects (captured in #39957). On November 1, 2005, China Eximbank and the National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of the Republic of Uzbekistan signed an agreement to allocate a 21 million RMB loan for the supply of 45 units of diagnostic equipment and their installation in 15 oncology centers (also known as "dispensaries"). The equipment was used for the diagnosis, prevention and treatment of cancers. The loan carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period, 0.2% commitment fee, and 0.2% management fee. 

The National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of the Republic of Uzbekistan then used the proceeds of this China Eximbank loan to on-lend to an unidentified entity at an interest rate of 2.15%. 3 of these dispensaries are located in Tashkent and the other 12 are located in various regions of the country. China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (CMC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is "Оснащение диагностическим оборудованием онкологических центров”.
sources: https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305021_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_05_2005_g_n_pp-82_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=407118_postanovlenie_kabineta_ministrov_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_19_07_2004_g_n_338_o_merah_po_dalneyshemu_razvitiyu_sotrudnichestva_s_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respublikoy, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/docs/1157093?query=1540, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=104082_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_24_02_2006_g_n_pp-289_o_merah_po_realizacii_investicionnogo_proekta_osnashchenie_diagnosticheskim_oborudovaniem_onkologicheskih_centrov_s_ispolzovaniem_lgotnogo_kredita_pravitelstva_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki%20and%20, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305021_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_05_2005_g_n_pp-82_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese Government grants $4 million for the supply and installation of medical oxygen generators
description:
In 2014, Chinese Government provided a $4 million grant for the supply and installation of medical oxygen generators for large hospitals in Uzbekistan. The project provided the supply and installation of 40 medical oxygen generators. The Ministry of Health of Uzbekistan was responsible for the project.

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is Поставка и инсталляция генераторов медицинского кислорода для крупных больниц.

title: China commits to provide mobile inspection systems to Uzbekistan for customs procedures
description: On July 25, 2013, Uzbekistan and China signed an exchange note on implementation of the project on supply of mobile inspection complexes to equip customs posts of Uzbekistan with the grant of the Government of China. The signing ceremony was held at the Ministry of Foreign Economic Relations, Investment and Trade. Minister of Foreign Economic Relations, Investment and Trade of Uzbekistan Elyor Ganiev and Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of China Zhang Xiao signed the document. The project included supply of mobile inspection complexes, their assembly and commissioning at the border customs posts, and training of employees of the customs services.

title: China Eximbank provide $10.7 million loan for ICT in Rural Areas Project
description:
In 2009, China Eximbank and National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $10,722,880 loan agreement for an ICT in Rural Areas Project. The terms of the loan were as follows: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period. 2.5% interest, 0.3% management fee, and 0.3% commitment fee. The proceeds of the loan were used to support contracts between Uzbektelecom JSC and Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd and ZTE Corporation. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian name of this project is "Развитие информационно-коммуникационной структуры АК "Узбектелеком" в сельской местности".
sources: https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=401266_postanovlenie_kabineta_ministrov_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_21_12_2009_g_n_321_ob_utverjdenii_perechnya_oborudovaniya_materialov_i_zapasnyh_chastey_importiruemyh_v_ramkah_realizacii_investicionnogo_proekta_razvitie_informacionno-kommunikacionnoy_struktury_ak_uzbektelekom_v_selskoy_mestnosti_finansiruemogo_za_schet_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki_stranam_-_chlenam_shanhayskoy_organizacii_sotrudnichestva&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana#%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BB, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/pp2xj2914xuw916/CHINA%20EXIMBANK%20LOAN%20TO%20UZBEKTELECOM%20FOR%20ICT%20IN%20RURAL%20AREAS.pdf?dl=0, Other; https://mitc.uz/ru/pages/Documents/623, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: This project is coded up to country level since there is no specified 'rural area' that received funding from the loan, also multple areas may benefit from the loan

title: Chinese Government grants RMB 13 million for the provision of medical equipment and computer equipment
description: On November 11, 2004, the Chinese government granted RMB 13 million to Uzbekistan for the provision of medical equipment and computer equipment. Specifically, the medical equipment was worth 5 million RMB and computer equipment was worth 8 million RMB.
sources: http://russian.people.com.cn/31521/2981588.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=584738_soglashenie_mejdu_pravitelstvom_respubliki_uzbekistan_i_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki_o_predostavlenii_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki_medicinskogo_oborudovaniya_stoimostyu_5_(pyat)_millionov_kitayskih_yuaney_i_kompyuternoy_tehniki_stoimostyu_8_(vosem)_millionov_kitayskih_yuaney_pravitelstvu_respubliki_uzbekistan_(tashkent_11_noyabrya_2004_goda_vstupilo_v_silu_11_11_2004_g_)&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Coded up to the country level since the medical equipment and computer equipment amountedf to 13 million and would be used throghout the country. Furhtermore, it was given tot eh governemnt and not a specific ministry.
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese government provides RMB 30 million interest-free loan for the acquistion and installation of household gas meters (linked to #72133)
description:
On April 11, 2001, the Chinese Government signed an RMB 30 million interest-free loan agreement with the National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of Uzbekistan for the acquisition and installation of household gas meters. The reported terms of this loan were as follows: 0% interest, maturity of 20 years and grace period of 10 years.

The National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of Uzbekistan then used the proceeds from this loan to on-lend (through a subsidiary loan agreement) to the Boskommungaz Enterprise («Бошкоммунгаз» агентства) of the Uzkommunkhizmat Agency («Узкоммунхизмат»).

This project is linked to #72133, a 99 million RMB loan for the acquisition and installation of gas meters in 2003.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcca00020011206dxc50000a&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://continent-online.com/Document/?doc_id=31031113, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Coded up to the country level since the household gas meters were distributed throghout the country without a specific district mentioned.
name: Uzbekistan

title: CNTIEC Provided Computer Equipment to Uzbekistan (linked to #39957)
description: On June 15, 2004, China Eximbank signed an agreement to provide a 300 million RMB concessional loan to the Republic of Uzbekistan for various projects (captured in #39957). Using the financing from this concessional loan, the Uzbekistan government financed the purchase of more than 30,000 computers and corresponding network from China National Technology Import and Export Corporation. The total cost of the computers and office equipment was $19 million USD. The computers were given to the Uzbekistan Ministry of Education to allocate to 2,054 schools in Uzbekistan. The goal of the computers was to establish a computer classroom with 15-18 computers in over 1,900 schools in Uzbekistan.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/200804/20080405506660.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cntic.com.cn/Portals/8/Uploads/Files/2014/9-26/635473473574076000.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305021_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_05_2005_g_n_pp-82_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Coded up to the country level since the computers that were given to the Uzbekistan Ministry of Education were then given to 2,054 schools all throughout Uzebkistan with no specific distri beign the only one to recive computers
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese Government grants 25,539,000 USD for the provision of multimedia equipment to 1st-4th grade classrooms (Linked with projects #72571, #72568, #72567, #72569, #72570, and #72564)
description: On August 22, 2014, China agreed to allocate US$25,539,000 to the Ministry of Public Education of Uzbekistan for the provision of multimedia equipment for 1st to 4th grade classrooms. The donation money was utilized in two phases. During the first phase, 6,642 sets of equipment were purchased for $11,489,000, while 8,123 sets were purchased during phase two for $14,050,000. These sets of equipment were comprised of: 1 computer, 2 speakers, 1 optical mouse, 1 video projector, 1 interactive whiteboard, 1 TV tuner for computer equipment The classroom upgrades seek to improve teacher proficiency in foreign language instruction in classrooms across the republic. The acquisition was part of a push by Uzbekistan to attract grant aid for its education system. It was reported that Uzbekistan attracted $225.6 million of grant aid for this purpose, some of which was provided by the People's Republic of China. As such, this project is linked to several other Chinese donations to the education sector during this timeframe: #72564 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 5th-9th #72568 for the purchase of 740 pieces of computer equipment for special needs students #72569 for the purchase of computer hardware and computer equipment. #72570 for the equipping of children's centers 'Barkamol Avlod' with 434 sets of computer equipment #72571 for the purchase of new stage equipment for the Republican Center for Children's Artistic Creativity #72567 for the purchase of new equipment for the Center for the Development of Multimedia General Education Programs (CDMEP) STAFF_NOTE: News sources put this figure at $73,500,000 - this is the number for the aggregate grant for both grades 1-4 and 5-9, which we have split between two separate projects
sources: http://tm.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201408/20140800708334.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://silkroadnews.org/en/news/uzbekistan-will-receive-from-china-73-5-million-for-school-facilities, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nuz.uz/ekonomika-i-finansy/24892-priobretenie-dvuh-drimlaynerov-dlya-uzbekiston-havo-yullari-profinansiroval-kitay.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g6DTNMS2LBo, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/22hvebgshk1eviz/IQ%20participates%20in%20China%20foreign%20aid%20project%20and%20provides%20IQ%20Interactive%20Whiteboard%20to%201303%20schools%20of%20Uzbekistan.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://china-uz-friendship.com/?p=12347, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Coded up to the country level since the grant was used for multimedia equipment that was given to the Uzbekistan Ministry of Education which was then given to 1st-4th grade classrooms all throughout Uzebkistan with no specific district beign the only one to recive this equipment.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China extends a 150 million USD loan to Uzbekistan to cover the cost of import contracts
description: On January 31, 2015, the Uzbek National Bank and China Development Bank signed a credit Agreement totaling USD 150 million. This Agreement envisages financing of up to 85% of the cost of import contracts on the supply of technological equipment and corresponding services supplied on the contract of no less than 50% of Chinese origin. Loan details are unknown.
sources: https://en.trend.az/business/economy/2431444.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nbu.uz/upload/iblock/e22/3_GO_NBU.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Coded up to the country level since the loan to Uzbekistan was for the cost of import contracts, which impact the country as a whole
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese Embassy grants contest winners a trip to China
description: In August 2014, the Chinese Embassy in Uzbekistan funded 5 standouts from Chinese National Culture Centre and the winner of the contest 'I and the Great Silk Road of the new century to visit Beijing, Dalian, and Xinjiang. They learned about Chinese culture, language and traditions about their neighbor China.'
sources: http://uz.chineseembassy.org/rus/zwgx/rwhz/t1189875.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Not able to be subnationally coded
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Development Bank provides $15.5 million loan for the Uzbektelecom Telecommunication Network Reconstruction Project
description:
In 2007, China Development Bank provided an $15,566,490 loan to Aloqabank for on-lending to Uzbektelecom (a state-owned telecommunications operator).  Uzbektelecom used the proceeds of this loan to purchase telecommunication equipment from Huawei. The loan carries the following terms: 8 year maturity, 2 year grace period, interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus an unknown margin, 0.15% commitment fee, and 0.30% management fee.

Huawei was the contractor. The total value of Uzbektelecom's contract with Huawei was $18.313 million, and it included 70 mobile phone base stations installed in 9 regions with a total capacity of 40,000 gates; 36 data transmission systems with a total capacity of 100,000 ports; and 124,000 NGN network devices and 5.56 million ports of C&C08 type digital communication station equipment.  

The Uzbektelecom Telecommunication Network Reconstruction Project was completed on September 30, 2008. 

Staff Note: The Russian name of this project is "Реконструкция и развитие телекоммуникационной сети акционерной компании "Узбектелеком”.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/200702/20070204410859.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/200612/20061204167089.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/catalog/201008/20100807080906.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200810/20081005811079.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305853_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_01_2007_g_n_pp-572_o_dalneyshem_razvitii_i_modernizacii_telekommunikacionnyh_setey_akcionernoy_kompanii_uzbektelekom, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aloqabank, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://lex.uz/docs/1120277?ONDATE=27.02.2009%2000, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Purchased products were widely dispersed
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Eximbank provides $8 million loan for the Reconstruction and Development of Telecommunication Network of JSC Uzbektelecom Project (linked to #39956)
description:
On November 11, 2004, China Eximbank signed a General Loan Agreement for a 300 million USD preferential buyer's credit to Uzbekistan (captured in #39956). On November 11, 2005, China Eximbank signed an individual agreement under the line of credit to provide the Republic of Uzbekistan with $8 million loan for the Reconstruction and Development of Telecommunication Network of JSC Uzbektelecom Project. The intent of the project is to provide high-quality telephone communications by replacing analogue stations with digital ones. 

Huawei was awarded the contract for the modernization of fixed network of "Uzbektelecom" in six regions of the country. They also launched feasibility study for the expansion of the telecommunications system of the republic. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is Реконструкция и развитие телекоммуникационной сети акционерной компании “Узбектелеком”. The loan details were unknown.
sources: http://www.uzimpex.uz/en/events/market_years/86/ , Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://csef.ru/en/politica-i-geopolitica/416/kitaj-pomogaet-sredneaziatskim-rezhimam-s-proslushkoj-i-slezhkoj-2762, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=407118_postanovlenie_kabineta_ministrov_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_19_07_2004_g_n_338_o_merah_po_dalneyshemu_razvitiyu_sotrudnichestva_s_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respublikoy , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/docs/2332640?query=%D0%BF%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%82%D1%80, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uzimpex.uz/en/events/partners/89/, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305021_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_05_2005_g_n_pp-82_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Coded up ot the country level as the Reconstruction and Development of Telecommunication Network of JSC Uzbektelecom Project would help various districts and a more granular location could not be found
name: Uzbekistan

title: CDB provides UzbekNefteGaz a $30 million loan for the purchase of high-tech exploration and prospecting equipment
description:
In 2017, CDB provided UzbekNefteGaz with $30 million USD for the purchase of high-tech exploration and prospecting equipment.

National oil and gas company UzbekNefteGaz looks to CNPC and its affiliates for the supply of equipment and machinery. UzbekNefteGaz aims to improve its currently available proven reserves map and define the geographic areas with high potential for further development. The deal is signed within the framework of the state’s requirement that UzbekNefteGaz doubles domestic oil extraction. 

STAFF_NOTE: The loan details are unknown.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/ezi35ykc5p6p43k/CADGAT_23_BRI_Mineral_Exploration_Extraction_and_Processing.docx?dl=0, Academic Journal Article
GEO_notes: Coded up to the country level since the purchase of high-tech exploration and prospecting equipment would be used to find better geogrpahic areas to develop due to oil which could be any district.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Development Bank loans National Bank of Uzbekistan 100 million USD
description: In 2013, the China Development Bank extended a line of credit to the National Bank of Uzbekistan worth of 100 million USD to encourage small enterprise and entrepreneurship development in Uzbekistan. Details about the credit line's loan terms are unclear. As of 2015, within the framework of this credit line 42 projects were financed by the total amount of USD 51.9 million. Credits were provided for up to 8 years to finance up to 85% of the cost of import contracts for supplying technological equipment and corresponding maintenance of goods and services. Supplies on the contract were of no less than 50% of Chinese origin.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=MENREP0020131004e9a40002k&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TCASIA0020131004e9a300003&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=CEASEN0020131003e9a3000m9&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.azernews.az/region/87748.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nbu.uz/upload/iblock/e22/3_GO_NBU.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Development Bank provides $179.3 million loan for acquisition of five A-320-200 Airbus aircraft (Linked with project #72506)
description:
In 2010, China Development Bank and the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $179,377,000 loan agreement for the acquisition of five A-320-200 Airbus aircraft. The loan carried the following terms: 10 year maturity, 3 year grace period, and an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 2.8% margin.

This acquisition commenced during 2010, when advance payments were made totaling 78.6 million US dollars. The delivery was completed by early 2011. This loan resulted in a follow up agreement for the purchase of four Boeing-767-300ER aircraft (see project #72506).

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is ия приобретения пяти самолетов «А-320-200». Some sources indicate that the Government of Uzbekistan purchased six rather than five A-320-200 Airbus aircraft.
sources: https://www.lex.uz/acts/2253356#2253427, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/acts/2255911, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.lex.uz/docs/1956213, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://kaztag.info/ru/news/gosbank-razvitiya-kitaya-predostavit-uzbekskim-avialiniyam-kredit-na-156-mln-dlya-zakupki-4-boingov, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.china-embassy.org/chn/sgxx/sgsd/t820892.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/14154, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: Coded up to the country level since the five A-320-200 Airbus aircraft that were purchased would be used throghout uzbekistan
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Eximbank provide $17.3 million to supply residential cold and hot water meters
description:
On April 30, 2007, China Eximbank and Ipoteka Bank signed a $17,293,502.35 preferential buyer's credit (PBC) loan agreement for the procurement of Chinese-produced residential hot and cold water meters. The loan carried an interest rate of 2%, a 5 year grace period, a 20 year maturity, a 0.3% commitment fee, and a 0.3% management fee. It is to be repaid semi-annually.  

A consortium consisting of China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation and II YAN is the contractor responsible for project implementation. The consortium was contracted to provide more than 1 million hot and cold water meters to Uzbek public utilities and state local governments, and will be responsible for the installation of water meters. These water meters were to be installed in bungalows and buildings in Tashkent and other states. 

Staff Note: The Russian name of the project is «Оснащение жилищного фонда Республики Узбекистан приборами учета холодной и горячей воды».
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/200705/20070504634630.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/hlm/documents/Publications/CP_Uzbekistan_withCorr.EN.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.ipotekabank.uz/upload/Ipoteka_bank_2017%20Report%20and%20Opinion_ENG%20with%20sign.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-document/64787/42489-uzb-rrp.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://web.archive.org/web/20170517122653/http://www.ipotekabank.uz/upload/Ipoteka%20Bank%20IFRS%202016%20Report%20and%20Opinion_ENG%20with%20sign_pdf.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Coded up to the country level since the money provided was used to supply residential cold and hot water meters throghout the country of Uzbekistan, with no specific district benefiting
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Eximbank loans RMB 99.99 million for the acquistion and installation of 400,000 household gas meters (Linked to Project ID#39926)
description:
In 2003, China Eximbank provided the National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of Uzbekistan with RMB 99,990,000 loan agreement for the acquisition and installation of 400,000 household gas meters (Linked to Project ID#39926). The reported terms of this loan were as follows: 2.5% interest, maturity of 10 years and grace period of 4 years. The National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of Uzbekistan then used the proceeds from this loan to on-lend (through a subsidiary loan agreement) to the Boskommungaz Enterprise («Бошкоммунгаз» агентства) of the Uzkommunkhizmat Agency («Узкоммунхизмат»). 

STAFF_NOTE: One source identifies the interest rate as 3% rather than 2.5%. This distinction likely reflects the difference in the original loan agreement and the subsidiary loan agreement. The Russian project title is "для организации поставок в Республику Узбекистан приборов учета газа. This project is linked to a Chinese government 30 million RMB interest-free loan in 2001 for the acquisition and installation of household gas meters (Project ID#39926).
sources: https://uz2002.ru/kredit-eksimbanka-kitaya, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://lex.uz/docs/593180?query=%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B2%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8%D1%86, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/docs/593180?query=%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B2%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8%D1%86 , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/docs/290068?ONDATE=20.03.2002%2000 , Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: China provided a loan for the acquisition and installation of 400,000 household gas meters. However, there was no further information about where these households were located so it was coded up to country level.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Development Bank leads $1.4 billion syndicated loan for Line C of Central Asia-China Gas Pipeline in Uzbekistan (Linked to Project ID#54489, #39997, #40833, and #39955)
description:
In April 2008, Uzbekneftegaz National Holding Company and China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) created a joint venture (special purpose vehicle) called Asia Trans Gas LLC to assume responsibility for the design and construction of the 529 km Uzbekistan section of the Turkmenistan-China Gas Pipeline Line C (also known as the Central Asia-China Gas Pipeline). Uzbekneftegaz National Holding Company has a 50% equity stake and CNPC has a 50% equity stake in Asia Trans Gas LLC.

Line C is 1830 km in length, 529km of which is within Uzbekistan. With a designed capacity of 25 billion cubic meters per annum, Line C’s pipe diameter is 1,219mm, 152mm larger than Line A/B. Line C starts at Turkmenistan-Uzbekistan border and ends at Horgos, in the Xinjiang region of China. Construction of Line C began on January 16, 2013. The line went into operation on May 31, 2014. Line C was officially commissioned on July 9, 2015. The total project cost of Line C Uzbekistan segment was 2.2 billion USD, and in 2013, a syndicated of banks (led by China Development Bank) provided a loan of $1.4 billion to Asia Trans Gas LLC  for the implementation of this project. Project Finance International estimates that CDB’s contribution to the syndicated loan amounted to $1.2 billion.

Financing for the Kazakhstan section of Line C is recorded in #39997. Financing for Line A and B are recorded in #54489 and Line D is recorded in #39955. See #40833 for umbrella overview of the Turkmenistan-China Gas Pipeline.

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 中国-中亚天然气管道C线. The terms and conditions of the syndicated loan are unknown.
sources: http://www.cnpc.com.cn/en/FlowofnaturalgasfromCentralAsia/FlowofnaturalgasfromCentralAsia2.shtml, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/tupxw/200912/20091206674970.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pfie.com/Journals/2014/02/12/o/l/l/PFILeagueTables2013.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.agp.com.kz/?p=1605, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/ym1jn2dk59z4s31/Project%20history%20_%20AGP.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.bjnews.com.cn/feature/2017/05/12/443045.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://xatb.mofcom.gov.cn/article/shangwxw/201406/20140600622533.shtmlhttp://xatb.mofcom.gov.cn/article/shangwxw/201406/20140600622533.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/headnews/201104/20110407512503.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://iteca.uz/oilgasconference/rus/PressCentre/index.php?ELEMENT_ID=42566, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://lex.uz/docs/1378049?ONDATE=16.10.2017%2010, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://oilcapital.ru/news/transport/01-06-2012/stroitelstvo-tretiey-ocheredi-uzbekskogo-uchastka-gazoprovoda-v-kitay-zavershitsya-v-2015-g, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://azizovpartners.uz/en/services/sample-of-projects/project-finance/, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://www.dropbox.com/s/g0lany8wv8oxwxc/Flow%20of%20natural%20gas%20from%20Central%20Asia.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
GEO_notes: I could not an exact map of the pipeline or the endpoints so I had to code up to account for the route of the pipeline. The pipeline will help provide gas to Uzbekistan.
name: Uzbekistan

title: CDB issues 20 million USD credit line to National Bank of Uzbekistan for small businesses development
description: In May 2006, China Development Bank provided $20 million USD credit line for National Bank of Uzbekistan to support small business. According to one source, the credit line has a period of nine years, with a two-year grace period at an annual interest rate based on LIBOR plus 1.5 percent. Specifically, the loan is being offered to support on-lending to small- and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZREPE0020060906e29600001&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/200612/20061204167089.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://archive.constantcontact.com/fs133/1103850501106/archive/1115134385392.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/catalog/201008/20100807080906.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: China gave 20 million to the National Bank of Uzbekistan to fund small businesses. There was no information on where these businesses were located so it was coded up to country level.
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese Government grants $3 million for Phase 2 of 3,000-bed equipment project (Linked to Project ID#72179)
description:
In 2014, Chinese Government provided a $3 million grant for Phase 2 of a project to equip Uzbek medical institutions with 3,000 beds. Within the framework of this project, it was envisaged to supply 3,000 functional beds for equipping medical institutions in Uzbekistan, especially institutions for socially significant diseases (psychiatry, tuberculosis, narcology). The Uzbek Ministry of Health was responsible for the project.

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian title of the project is Оснащение функциональными кроватями медицинских учреждений республики. Фаза 2. Phase I of this project is captured in #72179.
sources: https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: can't find all beds subnationally
name: Uzbekistan

title: China provides a $2,132,000 USD grant to Uzbekistan for the purchase of computer equipment for the Barkamol Avlod Children's Centers (linked to projects #71501, #72568, #72567, #72569, #72571, and #72564)
description: In 2014, China committed a US$2,132,000 to Uzbekistan for the acquisition of 434 sets of modern computer equipment for learning foreign languages, and 434 sets for learning computer science. These sets of computing equipment were provided to Barkamol Avlod Children's Centers established by the Uzbek government in 2011. The foreign language sets included: 1 video projector, 1 laptop, 1 speaker, 1 optical mouse, 1 whiteboard, 1 TV tuner, 1 air conditioner The computer science sets included: 1 video projector, 1 computer, 1 printer, 1 stabilizer, 1 white board, 1 air conditioner The acquisition was part of a push by Uzbekistan to attract grant aid for its education system. It was reported that Uzbekistan attracted $225.6 million of grant aid for this purpose, some of which was provided by the People's Republic of China. As such, this project is linked to several other Chinese donations to the education sector during this timeframe: #71501 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 1st-4th #72568 for the purchase of 740 pcs of computer equipment for special needs students #72567 for the purchase of new equipment for the Center for the Development of Multimedia General Education Programs (CDMEP) #72569 for the purchase of computer hardware and computer equipment #72571 for the purchase of new stage equipment for the Republican Center for Children's Artistic Creativity #72564 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 5th-9th
sources: https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Code up. These were distributed to as many as 215 childrens centers
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Commits to Give Uniforms worth US$150,000 to Uzbekistan's Police
description: In February 2015, the Ministry of Public Security of China signed an agreement to provide uniforms (summer and winter clothing) to Uzbekistan's Ministry of Internal Affairs' policemen for a total amount of USD$150,000.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201502/20150200888013.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: These policemen operate throughout the country
name: Uzbekistan

title: China grants 1 million RMB in forensic equipment
description: In November 2002, China's Ministry of Public Security committed a donation of forensic laboratory equipment worth 1 million RMB to their Uzbek counterparts. The current state of this project is unknown. According to Chinese source, the contract is signed in 2001.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020021127dybr00209&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gj/zlk/2014/01-15/213_2.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: There is no indication of where this forensic equipment went
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Eximbank provides $177.6 million preferential buyer’s credit loan for purchase of oil rig equipment
description:
On April 6, 2007, China Eximbank provided a $177,601,952 preferential buyer’s credit loan to Uzbekneftegaz (Uzbekistan's state-owned oil and gas company) for the acquisition of large-scale oil rigs, 3D seismic exploration equipment, cement trucks, and other specialized equipment. The loan carried the following terms: 15-year maturity, 5 year grace period, a 3.5% interest rate, 0.3% commitment fee, and 0.3% management fee. The remaining project costs ($31.5 million) were funded by Uzbekneftegaz.

On April 6, 2007, Uzgeoburneftegaz (a subsidiary of Uzbekneftegaz) also signed a contract with China Petroleum Technology & Development Corp to supply 23 drilling rigs and a contract with China National Machinery Industry Corporation to supply 10 cementers. Then, in September 2009, China Petroleum Technology & Development Corporation and China National Machinery Industry Corporation (SINOMACH) delivered 23 drilling rigs, four cranes, and 10 cementing units worth $209.1 million USD. 

Staff Note: The Russian project title is Оснащение предприятий НХК «Узбекнефтегаз» буровыми установками и сейсморазведочными комплексами 3Д.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCCA00020090916e59g000ul&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/chinese-companies-supply-drilling-equipment-uzbekistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.uzdaily.com/articles-id-2836.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://enews.fergananews.com/articles/1951, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/200705/20070504659903.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200811/20081105875208.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.lex.uz/acts/1257293, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/vults7c3kv89j45/BU_PITCH_ENGLISH_2018.xlsx?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/docs/1168083?lact_id=1168083&version=print, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/ru/docs/1168083, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: Description indicates mobile equipment was donated so code up
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 50 million interest-free loan for agricultural machinery and computer equipment
description: In May 2004, the Chinese Government and the Government of Uzbekistan signed a RMB 50 million interest-free loan agreement for the provision of agricultural machinery and computer equipment. The agreement was signed by Uzbekistan's Foreign Minister, Sodiq Safoyev, and China's Ambassador to Uzbekistan, Gao Yusheng.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCCA00020040506e056001b9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gasandoil.com/news/russia/56d4f454b00d574ebb57c4ca2503154f, Media Report, including Wikileaks
