name: Uzbekistan

title: China grants 22 tons of humanitarian relief worth 3 million RMB
description: On June 21 2010, China delivered 22 tons of humanitarian aid to Uzbekistan, including food, blankets, generators, mobile showers, and medications. The value of this donation was 3 million RMB. This aid would ease the strain on Uzbekistan to resettle refugees fleeing unrest in Kyrgyzstan's Osh region.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZBDAY0020100621e66l00001&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/xwfw_665399/s2510_665401/2535_665405/t710645.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://china.org.cn/world/2010-06/21/content_20307239.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201006/20100606982244.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: China delivered humanitarian aid to Uzbekistan to deal with refugees from Krygyzstan's Osh region. There was no information about where the refugees were located so it was coded up to country level.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Development Bank Provides US$10.6 million for Uzbek Universities to join E-Education Network (linked to #53952)
description:
In 2011, China Development Bank provided a $10,608,000 export seller's credit loan to Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. to assist 200 schools in Uzbekistan in joining the "e-education network."  Using the seller's credit facility, Huawei financed the purchase of e-education equipment for Uzbektelecom JSC . The loan carries the following terms: 2.2% interest rate. 2.5 year maturity.

The total value of the contract between Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd.  and Uzbektelecom JSC  is $12.4 million and its purpose is to link a network of higher education and vocational education institutions through the creation of a fiber optic network.

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is "Создание национальной сети "Электронное образование" в Республике Узбекистан”. Joint Stock Company Uzbektelecom and Chinese Huawei Technologies Co. Ltd signed a contract worth $12.4 million. The funding was part of an overall loan of US$37.2 million for ICT projects in Uzbekistan (captured in project #53952).
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201212/20121208494978.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://en.c114.com.cn/577/a709195.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://podrobno.uz/cat/economic/kitaici-moderniziryut-optovolokno-v-Uzbekistane/ , Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=401406_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_16_04_2012_g_n_pp-1740_o_merah_po_realizacii_investicionnogo_proekta_sozdanie_nacionalnoy_seti_elektronnoe_obrazovanie_v_respublike_uzbekistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/19770, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: China provided a loan so that 200 schools in Uzbekistan could join an "e-education network." This is an electronic system that is designed to improve education. There was no information on where these schools were located, so it was coded up to country level.
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese Government grants $3 million for Phase 1 of 3,000-bed equipment project (Linked to Project ID#72180)
description:
In 2014, the Chinese government provided a $3 million grant for Phase 1 of a project to equip Uzbek medical institutions with 3,000 beds. Within the framework of this project, it was envisaged to supply 3,000 functional beds for equipping medical institutions in Uzbekistan, especially institutions for socially significant diseases (psychiatry, tuberculosis, narcology). The Uzbek Ministry of Health was responsible for the project.

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian title of the project is Оснащение функциональными кроватями медицинских учреждений республики. Фаза 1. Phase II of this project is captured in #72180.
sources: https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: according to the source, the donation is for beds in medical institutions for socially important diseases. Since the beds were gifted to the ministry of health and not a specific hospital, I coded up to the country to reflect the fact these beds were most likely distributed acorss many medical institutions across the country.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Eximbank loans $61.69 million to Uzbektelecom for National Telecom Network Project
description:
In 2014, China Eximbank loaned $61.69 million to Uzbektelecom (a state-owned telecommunications operator) for National Telecom Network Project in Uzbekistan. This project will expand the broadband backbone network to regional centers in Uzbekistan.

The project will be implemented to increase reliability and vitality of telecommunication network and expand its capacity up to 100 Gbps. The project will seek to install data transfer equipment based on DWDM/SDH/IP/MPLS technologies. It is also planned to install OTN technology to full reservation of existing transport network of Uzbektelecom. 

Staff Note: The Chinese project title is 乌兹别克斯坦电信全国网项目. Loan details are unknown.
sources: http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/aboutExim/annals/2016/201807/P020180712402151419837.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/wbcha87u81mnf7g/60%20million%20China%20Eximbank%20loan%20to%20Uzbektelecom%20Joint%20Stock%20Company.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/26185, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://203.187.160.133:9011/www.eximbank.gov.cn/c3pr90ntc0td/aboutExim/annals/2016/201806/P020180610508677212813.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: The project supports broadband infrastructure for Uzbektelecom which is a national corporation. Because the aid strengthens the broadband system as a whole, I coded up to the country level to reflect this.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Eximbank provides a $5.9 million loan for the Satellite-Based TV and Radio Broadcasting Project (linked to #39956)
description:
On November 11, 2004, China Eximbank signed a General Loan Agreement for a 300 million USD preferential buyer's credit to Uzbekistan (captured in #39956). In 2005, China Eximbank signed an agreement to allocate $5.9 million USD of the buyer's credits to the Republic of Uzbekistan for the Satellite-Based TV and Radio Broadcasting Project. Alcatel Shanghai Bell Information Products Co., LTD. was the contractor. The project intended to ensure effective reception and transmission television and radio broadcasting programs in hard-to-reach and remote settlements of Uzbekistan. 

According to the contract between ZAO «Uzimpeksaloka» (in the name of the radio communications system and broadcasting activities Center) of CIAU (Communication And Information Agency Of Uzbekistan) and the company of Alcatel Shanghai Bell Information in Uzbekistan, the following facilities were put: Satellite receiving and transmitting earth station, 396 sets of TV transmitters, 374 sets of radio transmitters, 400 sets of satellite receiving systems, mounting facilities, and measuring facilities of broadcasting transmitters. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian name of this project is Организация телерадиовещания с использованием спутниковых систем связи. Loan details are unknown.
sources: http://www.uzimpex.uz/en/events/market_years/86/ , Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=407118_postanovlenie_kabineta_ministrov_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_19_07_2004_g_n_338_o_merah_po_dalneyshemu_razvitiyu_sotrudnichestva_s_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respublikoy , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://cemc.uz/en/page/133/the-arrangements-on-realizing-the-project-about-organizing-broadcasting-using-satellite-communication-system , Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305021_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_05_2005_g_n_pp-82_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_sources: http://www.uzimpex.uz/en/events/market_years/86/ , Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=407118_postanovlenie_kabineta_ministrov_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_19_07_2004_g_n_338_o_merah_po_dalneyshemu_razvitiyu_sotrudnichestva_s_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respublikoy , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://cemc.uz/en/page/133/the-arrangements-on-realizing-the-project-about-organizing-broadcasting-using-satellite-communication-system , Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305021_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_05_2005_g_n_pp-82_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: The goal of the project is to reach remote parts of the country with TV and radio. Because this project has such a wide scope, I coded up to the country level
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 157 million loan for Basic Education Schools Project (Linked to Project ID#72143)
description:
On July 18, 2005, China Eximbank and the National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of the Republic of Uzbekistan signed an RMB 157 million loan agreement for the provision of computer training equipment to 2055 primary ("basic educational") schools. As of June 2007, the RMB equivalent of $10.9 million had been disbursed through this loan agreement and $8.1 million had yet to be disbursed.  The China Eximbank loan carried the following terms: 2.5% interest rate, 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period, 0.2% commitment fee, an a 0.2% management fee.

In addition to this China Eximbank loan, the Chinese Government supported this project with a $1 million grant (captured in Project ID#72143). China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (CMC) was the contractor responsible for implementation of this project. According to the Uzbekistan government's document, the project was implemented from 2005 to 2007. 

Staff Note: This project is also known as the "Basic Education Schools Project". The Russian name of the project is "Оснащение общеобразовательных школ Республики Узбекистан учебными компьютерными классами. Some sources indicate that the project supported 2,055 primary schools, while others indicate that the project supported 1,900 schools.
sources: https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/CR/Issues/2016/12/31/Republic-of-Uzbekistan-Poverty-Reduction-Strategy-Paper-21636, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305258_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_11_2005_g_n_pp-226_o_merah_po_realizacii_proekta_osnashchenie_obshcheobrazovatelnyh_shkol_respubliki_uzbekistan_uchebnymi_kompyuternymi_klassami_s_ispolzovaniem_lgotnogo_kredita_i_granta_pravitelstva_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=407118_postanovlenie_kabineta_ministrov_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_19_07_2004_g_n_338_o_merah_po_dalneyshemu_razvitiyu_sotrudnichestva_s_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respublikoy, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://mg.uz/print/publish/doc/text60491_v_uzbekistane_svyshe_75_procentov_shkol_vo_vseh_regionah_strany_budut_obespecheny_kompyuternoy_tehnikoy, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=305021_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_23_05_2005_g_n_pp-82_o_merah_po_ispolzovaniyu_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-document/74695/37698-013-uzb-pcr.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.globalpartnership.org/sites/default/files/2013-09-Uzbekistan-Education-Sector-Plan-2013-2017.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

GEO_notes: The 2,000 schools were not concentrated in just one region of the country. Because of the sheer amount of schools affected by this project, I coded up to the country level to reflect this large scale project.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China provides a 156 Million USD loan for the purchase of four Boeing 767 aircraft (Linked to projects ID#71910 and #72507)
description: On May 11, 2011, Uzbekistan Airlines JSC announced that it would be utilizing $156 Million USD from a $500 million USD line of credit from China Development Bank (see project #72507) for the purchase of four new Boeing 767-300ER aircraft. The contract was fulfilled in full by July 4, 2013. The total value of the contract was $577.5 million. Loan details are unknown. Additional lending support for this project was provided by the Islamic Development Bank. This acquisition followed an earlier agreement from the CDB in which they provided a 179 million USD loan for the purchase of four Airbus A-320 aircraft (see project #71910).
sources: https://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/14154, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.china-embassy.org/chn/sgxx/sgsd/t820892.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://kaztag.info/ru/news/gosbank-razvitiya-kitaya-predostavit-uzbekskim-avialiniyam-kredit-na-156-mln-dlya-zakupki-4-boingov, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.lex.uz/docs/1956213, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://lex.uz/acts/2255911, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://en.trend.az/business/economy/2167532.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.uzdaily.uz/ru/post/16306, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201104/20110407512459.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: CDB provides $100 million loan for telecommunications projects (linked to #43087 and #54035)
description: In December 2014, China Development Bank pledged a loan of $550 million loan to Uzbektelecom (see Project ID#43087) for the purposes of telecommunication network expansion, developing the CDMA-450 mobile network, and implementation of FTTx fiber technology to Uzbekistan to develop the Uzmobile national GSM-operator. However, China Development Bank ultimately provided a $100 million loan that carried a maturity of 9 years, a grace period of 3 years, and an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 3.9% margin. The contractor responsible for project implementation was Huawei Technologies. Through this project, Uzbektelecom planned to install 3,900 base stations and 4,000 sets of radio relay equipment with the license capacity of 8 million numbers. The first phase of the project covered 1,020 of those base stations with the ablility to service 2 million numbers. Aloqabank also provided a $17.6 million loan to support this project. In 2012, China Development Bank financed the CDMA-450 mobile network and FTTx fiber technology through a $27 million USD loan (captured in #54035). Staff Note: One of the projects supported by the $100 million CDB loan was callled the CDMA-450 Cellular Network Expansion Project.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCCA00020141230eacu0012y&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.uzdaily.com/articles-id-30514.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://aboutuzbekistan.wordpress.com/2014/12/26/china-will-invest-550-million-in-the-uzbek-national-mobile-service-provider/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.telecompaper.com/news/huawei-wins-contract-for-uzmobile-network--1048712, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:Gde-uaHsyd8J:3gca.org/huawei-technologies-supply-equipment-uzmobile/&num=1&hl=en&gl=us&strip=1&vwsrc=0, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://web.archive.org/web/20141112010351/http://www.uz24.uz/en/Technologies/huawei-will-provide-uzbektelecom-equipment-for-gsm-network, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201302/20130200031263.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://mitc.uz/en/news/64, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/yd7ql9icrtxu4eh/100%20million%20CDB%20Loan%20to%20Uzbektelecom%20AK.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.timesca.com/index.php/news/7889-uzbektelecom-to-invest-21-million-to-expand-cdma-450-network, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: The project says that eh $100 million was intended to be used for Uzbektelecom to build 3,900 base stations. Because of this, I coded up to the country level because it was a national project.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Development Bank Loans $30 million USD to Uzbekistan's Ipoteka Bank
description: On July 26th, 2017, China Development Bank loaned $30 million USD to Uzbekistan's Ipoteka Bank over the period of 8 years. Loan payments are made semi-annually at an interest rate of 6M Libor+4% per annum. As of December 31st, 2017, the outstanding balance of the loan is UZS 52,106,489 thousand. Chairman of the board of Ipoteka bank said the loan resources will be directed to developing small businesses and private entrepreneurship in Uzbekistan, and to purchase modern equipment and tools. STAFF_NOTE: FEB 11 2019 The international 6M Libor rate in July 2017, 1.475%, was used to calculate interest rate.
sources: http://www.ipotekabank.uz/upload/Ipoteka_bank_2017%20Report%20and%20Opinion_ENG%20with%20sign.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/39365, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: Ipoteka Bank is just the intermediary institution for the loan as the bank said the loan would be used to promote small business and private entrepenuership. Because Ipoteka Bank has locations nationally, I felt it appropriate to code up to the country_level to reflect that the money could have an end destination of small business across Uzbekistan.
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 50 million interest-free loan for the provision of mechanical equipment to treat river sludge
description: On November 11, 2004, the Chinese Government signed an agreement to provide an RMB 50 million interest-free loan to Uzbekistan for the provision of mechanical equipment to treat river sludge.
sources: https://www.lex.uz/docs/1325728, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://russian.people.com.cn/31521/2981588.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=584739_soglashenie_mejdu_pravitelstvom_respubliki_uzbekistan_i_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki_o_predostavlenii_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki_partii_mehanicheskogo_oborudovaniya_dlya_ochistki_rechnogo_ila_stoimostyu_50_(pyatdesyat)_millionov_kitayskih_yuaney_pravitelstvu_respubliki_uzbekistan_(pekin_11_noyabrya_2004_goda_vstupilo_v_silu_11_11_2004_g_)&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: unclear where this work would be done
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese grants RMB 60 million for the provision of medical equipment and electricity
description: On November 3, 2007, the Chinese government signed an agreement to grant RMB 60 million for the provision of medical equipment and electricity to city and district hospitals in Uzbekistan. The Ministry of Health of the Republic of Uzbekistan took necessary measures to prepare the premises of the regional medical associations and to provide them with medical equipment purchased by the fund in a safe, targeted and effective manner.
sources: https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=306155_postanovlenie_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_ot_12_02_2008_g_n_pp-792_o_merah_po_obespecheniyu_effektivnogo_ispolzovaniya_grantovyh_sredstv_predostavlyaemyh_pravitelstvom_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki#%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BB, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: The source specifically says that leaders from the various regions, the city of Tashkent, and republic of Karakalpakstan should all work together to effectively distribute the aid. Because it mentions all regions of the country, I coded up.
name: Uzbekistan

title: Chinese Government grants RMB 700,000 for the provision of police equipment
description: On November 26, 2004, Chinese Government signed an RMB 700,000 grant for the provision of police equipment. Under the agreement between the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Republic of Uzbekistan and the Ministry of Public Security of the People’s Republic of China, the Chinese government granted 700,000 RMB to the Ministry of the Internal Affairs of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
sources: https://nrm.uz/contentf?doc=584736_soglashenie_mejdu_ministerstvom_vnutrennih_del_respubliki_uzbekistan_i_ministerstvom_obshchestvennoy_bezopasnosti_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki_o_predostavlenii_ministerstvom_obshchestvennoy_bezopasnosti_kitayskoy_narodnoy_respubliki_partii_policeyskogo_oborudovaniya_i_bezvozmezdnom_obespechenii_vsemi_neobhodimymi_rashodami_v_razmere_700_000_(semisot_tysyach)_yuaney_ministerstvu_vnutrennih_del_respubliki_uzbekistan_(pekin_26_noyabrya_2004_goda_vstupilo_v_silu_26_11_2004_g_)&products=1_vse_zakonodatelstvo_uzbekistana, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: The aid was given to the Ministry of Internal Affairs for Uzbekistan, but since the aid is police equiptment, I interpreted the ministry to be the intermediary recipient so I coded up to the country level to reflect the fact that the police equiptment most likely was distributed to police forces across the country.
name: Uzbekistan

title: China Development Bank loan to develop CDMA-450 mobile network, and implement FTTx fiber technology (linked to #53952 and #40324)
description: In 2012, China Development Bank agreed to loan Uzbekistan's Uzbek Telecom (Uzbektelecom) $107.6 million for the purpose of network expansion, developing the CDMA-450 mobile network, and implementation of FTTx fiber technology. The funds were sent in the second quarter of 2013, with which Uzbektelecom was expected to purchase implementation technology. These funds were also earmarked for overall network expansion and infrastructure improvements This project is linked to #53952. Only the confirmed costs for developing the CDMA-450 mobile network - US$18.19 million and implementing FTTx fiber technology US$9.01 million is recorded for this project. The project is also mentioned in China EXIM Bank annual report for 2016 (see attached exim source p.52); it is unclear how or whether China EXIM is financially involved. This project is linked to #40324, which describes $100 million USD loan from CDB to Uzbektelecom for the CDMA-450 network in 2014.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201212/20121208494978.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/21858, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.telegeography.com/products/commsupdate/articles/2013/02/01/uzbektelecom-secures-funding-for-network-development/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5a789b2a1f318da5a590af4a/t/5bfca9106d2a736f2eac1e0b/1543285011333/Infrastructure+Development+in+Central+Asia.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Technology/Documents/FeasibitlityStudies/ECOFeasibilityStudy.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/aboutExim/annals/2016/201807/P020180712402151419837.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
GEO_sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201212/20121208494978.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.uzdaily.uz/en/post/21858, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.telegeography.com/products/commsupdate/articles/2013/02/01/uzbektelecom-secures-funding-for-network-development/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5a789b2a1f318da5a590af4a/t/5bfca9106d2a736f2eac1e0b/1543285011333/Infrastructure+Development+in+Central+Asia.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Technology/Documents/FeasibitlityStudies/ECOFeasibilityStudy.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/aboutExim/annals/2016/201807/P020180712402151419837.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
GEO_notes: Wireless radio access (CDMA-450) does not just benefit one specific region of the country. Because this network infrastructure is supported by the national company Uzbektelecom, I coded up to the country level to reflect that increased wireless communication infrastructure benefited a large part of the population as a whole.
name: Uzbekistan

title: CDB provides $75 million loan to National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan for on-lending to small businesses
description: On June 11, 2010, National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan and China Development Bank (CDB) signed a $75 million line of credit agreement. The proceeds from the credit agreement will be used by the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan for on-lending to small businesses and to investment projects. The minimum value of subsidiary loans approved through this line of credit set at $100,000, and the share of supply of Chinese goods was not to be less than 50%. The CDB credit line carried the following terms: 8 year maturity, 3 year grace period, and an interest rate of LIBOR + a 3.5% margin. The credit line was opened without state guarantees and without insurance on the part of the export-import agencies. In total, 162 projects worth $74.99 million were financed with the proceeds from the CDB credit line by 2015, according to the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan.

name: Uzbekistan

title: China provides a $9,131,500 USD grant for the purchase of new equipment for the CDMEP (linked to projects #71501, #72568, #72571, #72569, #72570, and #72564)
description: In 2014, China committed a US$9,131,500 for the improvement of the activities of the Center for the Development of Multimedia General Education Programs (CDMEP). The grant was utilized for: 1) The acquisition of equipment for the server platform of the public education system in order to host educational and training portals, websites and web resources of educational institutions; 2) Equipment and modernization of the multimedia studio TsRMOP for the creation of educational programs, serials and online lessons 3) Purchase of equipment for uninterruptible power supply TsRMOP The acquisition was part of a push by Uzbekistan to attract grant aid for its education system. It was reported that Uzbekistan attracted $225.6 million of grant aid for this purpose, some of which was provided by the People's Republic of China. As such, this project is linked to several other Chinese donations to the education sector during this timeframe: #71501 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 1st-4th #72568 for the purchase of 740 pcs of computer equipment for special needs students #72569 for the purchase of computer hardware and computer equipment. #72570 for the equipping of children's centers 'Barkamol Avlod' with 434 sets of computer equipment #72571 for the purchase of new stage equipment for the Republican Center for Children's Artistic Creativity #72564 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 5th-9th
sources: https://www.lex.uz/acts/2428327, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: The grant was given to the Center for the Development of Multimedia General Education Programs. This money however was used for online educational resources and betterment of the online platform. For this reason, I coded up to the country level because the effects of this aid did not just benefit the Center but children across the country.
name: Uzbekistan
